title: Calories in Crab Rangoon
meta_description: Discover calories in crab rangoon per piece, including carbs, protein, fat, sodium, and tips for variations like baked versions.
assumptions: Standard fried crab rangoon: wonton wrapper filled with imitation crab, cream cheese, and green onions; ~35 g per piece.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand of ingredients, frying method, and portion size. Check restaurant or package labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One crab rangoon has about 120 kcal, mostly from fat and carbs in the fried wrapper.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Baked instead of fried (reduces oil absorption)
Add extra real crab meat (less cream cheese)
Air-fried version with light spray oil

faqs.q: How many calories in one crab rangoon?
Is crab rangoon high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, about 220 mg per piece from cream cheese and seasonings.

faqs.q: What's the protein content in crab rangoon?
faqs.a: Around 3 g per piece, mainly from the crab filling.

faqs.q: Can I make lower-calorie crab rangoon?
faqs.a: Yes, baking or air-frying cuts ~30-40 kcal by reducing oil.

faqs.q: How many carbs in crab rangoon?
faqs.a: About 10 g per piece, mostly from the wonton wrapper.
